snippet: President Hu Jintao of China and President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan announced a new strategic partnership, a sign of China’s interest in Afghanistan after NATO forces leave in 2014.
abstract: China's Pres Hu Jintao and Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai announce a new strategic partnership between the two countries, a sign of China's growing interest in Afghanistan after United States and NATO-led forces leave in 2014; promise to step up cooperation in security and the fight against terrorism, as well as increase intelligence sharing.
lead_paragraph: President Hu Jintao of China and President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan announced a new strategic partnership, a sign of China’s interest in Afghanistan after NATO forces leave in 2014.

headline.main: China Shows Interest in Afghan Security, Fearing Taliban Would Help Separatists
headline.print_headline: China Shows Interest in Afghan Security, Fearing Taliban Would Help Separatists
